value.title: Get-WindowsAutoPilotInfo
value.summary: This script uses WMI to retrieve properties needed for a customer to register a device with Windows Autopilot. Note that it is normal for the resulting CSV file to not collect a Windows Product ID (PKID) value since this is not required to register a device. Only the serial number and hardware hash will be populated.
value.author: Michael Niehaus

value.title: Install-RequiredModule
value.summary:
Parses a RequiredModules.psd1 listing modules and attempts to import those modules.
If it can't find the module in the PSModulePath, attempts to install it from PowerShellGet.

The RequiredModules list looks like this (uses nuget version range syntax):
@{
  "PowerShellGet" = "2.0.4"
  "Configuration" = "[1.3.1,2.0)"
  "Pester"    = "[4.4.2,4.7.0]"
}

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/package-versioning#version-ranges-and-wildcards
value.author: Joel 'Jaykul' Bennett

value.title: Stop-Start-AzureVM (Scheduled VM Shutdown/Startup)
value.summary: This PowerShell Workflow runbook connects to Azure using an Automation Credential and Starts/Stops a VM/a list of VMs/All VMs in a Subscription in-parallel.
value.author: Pradebban Raja
value.tags: Windows Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Automation, azure vm

value.title: Shutdown/Start VMs by tag
value.summary: This script shutdowns/starts VMs by a given tag and its value. If you don't have it, you have to create a Credential Asset with the name DefaultAzureCredential in order to access your account. You can know more about this script here: https://www.returngis.net/2016/07/por-que-eti
value.author: Gisela Torres
value.tags: Utility, Windows Azure Virtual Machines, PowerShell Workflow
